import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv('/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv')
data.isnull().sum()

import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv('/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv')
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
X=data[['Id','MSSubClass','LotArea','YrSold']]
y=data['SalePrice']

model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X,y)

y_pred = model.predict(X)

from sklearn.metrics import root_mean_squared_error, r2_score
rmse = root_mean_squared_error(y,y_pred)
r2 = r2_score(y,y_pred)
print(f'Root Mean Squared Error: {rmse}')
print(f'R-squared: {r2}')

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

train = pd.read_csv('/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv')

train = train.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'])

X = train.drop(columns=['SalePrice', 'Id'])
y = train['SalePrice']

X = X.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64'])

X = X.fillna(X.median())

model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X, y)

test = pd.read_csv('/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/test.csv')

X_test = test[X.columns]

X_test = X_test.fillna(X.median())

y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)


submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_pred_test
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(submission.head())
